--- title: "Lecture [12a] Activity" --- ![](../../img/programmer_2780E3.svg){.hero} ## Question 1 Create a ggplot from `mpg` that maps `displ` to x and `hwy` to y and includes a point geom. Facet the plot such that there are seven columns showing `class` levels and three rows showing `drv` levels.

Click here for the answer key
::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} library(tidyverse) ggplot(mpg, aes(x = displ, y = hwy)) + geom_point() + facet_grid(drv~class) ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](12a_Activity_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-1-1.png){width=672} ::: :::

## Question 2 Create a stacked bar chart from `mpg` that shows the proportion of each `class` of car that uses each type of drive train (`drv`). Use this plot to answer: which class of car uses only front-wheel drive (i.e., `"f"`) and which class of car is the most balanced in terms of using different types of drive trains? *Hint:* All bars should be the same height.

Click here for the answer key
::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} mpg |> ggplot(aes(x = class, fill = drv)) + geom_bar(position = "fill") ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](12a_Activity_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-2-1.png){width=672} ::: ::: All **minivans** in this dataset use the front-wheel drive type of drive train, and the **subcompact** class is the most balanced.

## Question 3 Create a ggplot from `mpg` that maps `hwy` to x and `manufacturer` to y; use `stat_summary()` to plot a pointrange geom for each manufacturer that puts the point at the median value and extends the range to the minimum and maximum values. Use this plot to answer: which two manufacturers exceeded 25 mpg highway fuel efficiency for all their cars in this dataset?

Click here for the answer key
::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} mpg |> ggplot(aes(x = hwy, y = manufacturer)) + stat_summary( fun = median, fun.min = min, fun.max = max, geom = "pointrange" ) ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](12a_Activity_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-3-1.png){width=672} ::: ```{.r .cell-code} # Hidden shortcut function :) mpg |> ggplot(aes(x = hwy, y = manufacturer)) + stat_summary( fun.data = median_hilow, geom = "pointrange" ) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr} ``` Warning: Computation failed in `stat_summary()` Caused by error in `fun.data()`: ! The package "Hmisc" is required. ``` ::: ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](12a_Activity_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-3-2.png){width=672} ::: ::: **Pontiac** and **Honda** both had minimum `hwy` values (i.e., lower ranges) above 25.

## Challenge Recreate the figure below from the `economics` tibble (included in \{tidyverse\}). *Hint:* This will require some reshaping as well as faceting. ::: {.cell} ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](12a_Activity_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-4-1.png){width=672} ::: :::

Click here for the answer key
::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} economics |> pivot_longer( pce:unemploy, names_to = "variable", values_to = "value" ) |> ggplot(aes(x = date, y = value)) + geom_line() + facet_grid(variable~., scales = "free_y") ``` :::
